Pre-Game Insights: India will look to be on top of its game in all three departments
The hosts would want their middle-order to fire
The pitch for the first game aided spinners considerably, and once the ball became soft, boundaries were hard to come by
India will rue the first outing as a missed opportunity in not taking a 1-0 lead in the three-match series
The Indian bowlers were largely impressive, and skipper Rohit Sharma showed no signs of rustiness
The team will look to improve in rotating the strike and establishing more enduring partnerships
The penchant for having more than a few left-handed batters was visible, with Washington Sundar, Axar Patel, and Shivam Dube forming the core of the middle order
With K.L. Rahul continuing to keep wickets, India seems to be prioritising having the cushion of a sixth bowler over Rishabh Pantâ€™s X-factor for now
